title: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Alameda County Registrar Of Voters)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2014, 2016, 2018) (Alameda County Registrar Of Voters)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2014 Nov Midterm Elections
2. 2016 Nov General Election
3. 2018 Nov Midterm Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the Dominion voting system. Alameda County already has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Alaska Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: FOI Records Request :: R000046-050125
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
This message is an acknowledgement that the Connecticut State Department of Education received your Freedom of Information Act request on 5/1/2025. It was given the reference number R000046-050125 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the FOI Records Center. 
Connecticut State Department of Education 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOI Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXTn6k1bOyyQrtnMK8p285ZPFrdNVAG-2Bn3JZcddFQCtWvORpj3x-2FJXAAbOdwUTOUtJQ-3D-3DfQ-5_uVGXHDZ6f2AXH-2Bf4RsnVhxWM4ULZT6VbUPjC8aNev1VJf4lsHZ48i9DQduXfnKCk8wepO3M37WY9BNesEsUg2vTU-2B6-2BqqEQOe8wOso-2BjCYD6IGvsDugsn5dy9x2A1YNB1lZwyKLBNTDBggP46g4VPoHOFmsA8wl52JS6UNlIjCSZxs4ZT09NYA8GZkSg8Ucn-2FtFlbffOfCKj0KEuoWCPRtyHOhjwM-2FIFTCZvrp7QG-2FYB-2FjPTyXPbkVuuGGz8BlE97XO0yXzQKeTnPwL4WHZyGPzEW-2Bl3EyVd10Ve2iYTYSlYf35Be3ICcBZH7jvkMvHKStklcVHJvkALA9YNVjD93HfkUms5w50G8pfhChJg1Awzb2LhFBemXKglOlSBMF37)

communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Requests Online Re: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Maryland SEA response
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting
the Maryland State Department of Education (MSDE). Please note that as of
March 25, 2025, all Maryland Public Information Act requests for MSDE records must
now be submitted online through the portal. (https://marylandpublicschools.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(watzz1mse3tukjdpq0z5avus))/supporthome.aspx) MSDE Public Records Center 
Please refrain from
submitting formal Maryland Public Information Act requests via email.
 T o get
started, visit the MSDE Public Records Center portal. Create
a login or login with your existing credentials Submit your Public
Information Act request Keep your tracking number in
a secure place for your records Messages can be
sent/received through the portal All other correspondences sent to this email address will
be reviewed within three business days. 
  Thank you. 

-- 
Michelle Berry Public Information Act Manager 
Office of Communications and Community Engagement 
pia.msde@maryland.gov (mailto:pia.msde@maryland.gov) 
200 W. Baltimore Street 
Baltimore, Maryland 21201 
marylandpublicschools.org 

The information contained in this communication (including any attachments) may be confidential and legally privileged. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication or any of its contents is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please re-send this communication to the sender indicating that it was received in error and delete the original message and any copy of it from your computer system.

communications.subject: Research Data Request :: D001739-050125
communications.communication:
Dear Ileana Garnand: 
Thank you for submitting a records request to the South Carolina Department of Education (SCDE) to be processed under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Your request was received on May 01, 2025, and is being processed in accordance with S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-10. Your request has been assigned the reference number D001739-050125 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the South Carolina Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

Attachments:

https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/ileanagarnand/156023/3.28.25_Cover_letter_and_annual_notice_re_FERPA_002.pdf
Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-education-6442%252Fsouth-carolina-sea-response-185934%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540ed.sc.gov&url_auth_token=AAA45y96mfQeDconPmc1alpcLkU%3A1uAfhh%3AuxNX1MZJ6s-ZAhO_ZAO9X3CuyELTamMkfXSUl_sEZPM 
The SCDE has 10 business days within which to inform you of the availability of the non-exempt “public records” that you have requested and to provide a time and cost estimate to make available those public records to you. For records more than 24 months old, the agency has 20 business days to respond on availability and cost. We do not guarantee that a records search will result in any responsive records being located. 
Please note that it is against South Carolina law to obtain or use personal information from public records for commercial solicitation. S.C. Code Ann. § 30-2-30 and -50. That law defines “personal information” as:  
[I]information that identifies or describes an individual including, but not limited to, an individual's photograph or digitized image, social security number, date of birth, driver's identification number, name, home address, home telephone number, medical or disability information, education level, financial status, bank account numbers, account or identification number issued by or used, or both, by any federal or state governmental agency or private financial institution, employment history, height, weight, race, other physical details, signature, biometric identifiers, and any credit records or reports. 
There are criminal penalties involved for noncompliance with the state’s prohibitions against using information secured through a FOIA records request for commercial solicitation. 
We do not make public, and will not produce in response to your request, those records that may be exempted under state law, including, but not limited to, trade secrets, personal information of students, confidential proprietary information, privileged communications, or protected information. We do not provide personally identifiable student or educator information. For a partial list of exemptions under the law, please see S.C. Code Ann. § 30-4-40. Additionally, we abide by all laws and regulations pertaining to the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and the S.C. Family Privacy Protection Act, and do not make public any records protected under these Acts. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the following link SCDE Public Records Center. You'll receive an e-mail when availability and cost have been determined. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXd-2FOVA0Sj1MDNwhjcqu2nw6Q2Q7ROxou-2FDGhcr-2BkVTeYZvkYnMEFYgb-2FGLaMN-2FqXu7UEafrGgxzq1DjVwlFLDmA-3Dz-k1_q1Hjge29tRwc4-2BSX6hMLgm2ZJcrZBmLXqiB-2F7zECo4ZH0jTH0-2FKDEPNXk-2FQDXQy0u6sXMm8WnVjWdmdAkddenSzHBNqvxeuvTlSKChJv9sIhj4ayweAQ-2Btwe1gQqi-2FN1XlBlr-2BB4blJPSqCEYYHVAXhd3NrLXcqDNoS1e2JJocMbnqrqLMliT8fBVeKnEw4-2Bp5ZT16FcR2uWemLWFtv2bsNmkG6FuSA4UCAM-2FZCBANZt9P-2BIMtGuc6XqBXg2DrgvgdcaMPxDn-2FQN0G9-2F5W-2FY2PR95VE-2FVBcFs8VILPDptX2MFML5CKEvX7MSiSVoMsQ2bdgWwmN16RjGFl2opisCLKSslN8W5XKNHnWf-2FXqAUfQPeUqLsVToRun6Z1bbGQtP)
